Created attachment 577054
Screenshot showing Touch Effects demo using 50% GPU load

I'm not sure how relevant this bug is, but I wanted to highlight my experiences with some of the Canvas based Test Drive demos. 2 demos in particular exhibit high GPU usage, even when nothing appears to be happening.

The Touch Effects demo for example; simply opening the page causes my GPU load to sit at 50% without interacting with the demo at all. This continues while the page is displayed, but drops while the tab is inactive or the browser is minimised.

comments.raw_text: What does this have to do with Direct2d?  The symptoms from comment 0 sound like the demo is doing canvas paints even when "inactive".  When the tab is inactive or the browser is minimized we throttle back the rate at which it can do such paints to once a second or less, so the GPU usage drops....

comments.text:
Apologies, it was a stab in the dark based on the test results of IE9 and Firefox being identical (even the %age GPU load was identical for both tests). I'm afraid I'm not experienced enough to make a more educated judgement.

As an additional data point, I tried the tests in Chromium 17, which should also have Canvas acceleration built in from what I gather. Test results were different this time. Touch Effects used 20% throughout, beginning from page load. Paintball only used 3% throughout and exhibited significantly worse performance than Fx or IE.

Again, I don't know enough about the details to decipher what's going on here. I'm pretty much just presenting something that appears to be an issue to me (GPU usage when there seems to be no activity in the actual canvas) and seeing whether you think there's an issue there too.
